Package reso.ip

Class IPLayer

java.lang.Object
reso.ip.IPLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPInterfaceListener
public class IPLayer extends Object implements IPInterfaceListener
This class models the IP layer in a node. It is responsible
  • for sending and receiving IP datagrams
  • determining the outgoing interface and gateway for a destination IP address
  • decreasing the TTL of IP datagrams when they are forwarded
  • delivering locally destined IP datagrams to the upper layer
  • maintaining a list of "logical interfaces" called adapters that allow to send IP datagrams through layer-2 interfaces (e.g. Ethernet)
  • maintaining a list of routes

Note : the current model does not support longest prefix match but only exact match.

      Returns:

    • receive

      public void receive​(IPInterfaceAdapter iface, Datagram msg) throws Exception
      Handle an IP datagram received from an IP adapter.

      The received IP datagram is delivered locally if the destination address is either broadcast or owned by the local host.

      Otherwise, if forwarding is enabled, a lookup is performed in the FIB and the datagram is forwarded through the outgoing interface, possibly through a gateway.

      Specified by:
      receive in interface IPInterfaceListener
      Parameters:
      iface - is the receiving IP adapter.
      msg - is the received IP datagram.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • forward

      protected void forward​(Datagram msg) throws Exception
      Forward an IP datagram.
      Parameters:
      msg - is the IP datagram to be forwarded.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • addRawListener

      public void addRawListener​(IPInterfaceListener l)
      Add a listener for any (IP) protocol. This listener will be called even for datagrams that are not destined to this node (kind or promiscuous mode).

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(int protocol, IPInterfaceListener l)
      Add a listener for a specific protocol number. This listener will only be called when a received datagram is destined to the local node and when the datagram's protocol number matches that of the listener.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener​(int protocol, IPInterfaceListener l)
      Remove a listener for a specific protocol.

    • addRoute

      public void addRoute​(IPAddress dst, String name) throws Exception
      Add a route to an IP address through an outgoing IP adapter. The IP adapter is identified by its name.
      Parameters:
      dst - is the route's destination (IP address).
      name - is the name of the outgoing IP adapter.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • addRoute

      protected void addRoute​(IPAddress dst, IPInterfaceAdapter oif) throws Exception
      Add a route to an IP address through an outgoing IP adapter. The reference to the IP adapter is provided. This method should only be used internally as the IP adapter must be owned by the local host.
      Parameters:
      dst - is the route's destination (IP address).
      oif - is the outgoing IP adapter.
      Throws:
      Exception

      public void addRoute​(IPAddress dst, IPAddress gateway) throws Exception

      Parameters:
      dst - is the routes's destination (IP address).
      gateway - is the gateway's IP address.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • send

      public void send​(IPAddress src, IPAddress dst, int protocol, Message payload) throws Exception
      Send an IP message. This method can be used by upper layers (applications) to send IP datagrams.
      Parameters:
      src - is the IP datagram's source IP address.
      dst - is the IP datagram's destination IP address.
      protocol - is the IP datagram's protocol number
      payload - is the IP datagram's payload.
      Throws:
      Exception
